Column Comment.0: UNIQUE WELL IDENTIFIER: A unique name, code or number designated as theprimary key for this row.
Column Comment.1: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.2: INTERVAL IDENTIFIER: Code identifying each unique interval.
Column Comment.3: ZONE IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the producing zone (formation) of the well.
Column Comment.4: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.5: ZONE VALUE OBSERVATION NUMBER: Number identifying each unique zoneobservation.
Column Comment.6: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.7: DATE FORMAT DESCRIPTION: Use this column to define the level of precision inthe DATE format colums, such as YYYY, or YYYQQ, or YYYYMM or YYYYMMDD
Column Comment.8: EFFECTIVE DATE: The date that the data in this row first came into effect.
Column Comment.9: EXPIRY DATE: The date that the data in this row was no longer active or in effect.
Column Comment.10: PARAMETER: Code identifying the type of ZONE VALUE being measured.
Column Comment.11: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.12: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.13: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.14: ZONE INTERVAL VALUE TYPE: The type of value that is associated with this wellzone interval. Note that where possible, it is preferable to use explicit tables - bychoice, iff possible, this table should only be used when no other table can be found.
Column Comment.15: ZONE VALUE: Calculated value of the zone interval measurement.
Column Comment.16: ZONE VALUE OUOM: Zone value original unit of measure.
Column Comment.17: ZONE VALUE UNIT: Zone value unit of measure.
Column Comment.18: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.19: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.20: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.21: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.22: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.23: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.24: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
